alert.note: Alert for Irion; Sterling; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 5:02PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Sterling, northwestern Tom Green and northern Irion Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 501 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms from southern Sterling County into northwestern Irion County, all moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Arden, Water Valley, Us-87 Near The Coke- Tom Green County Line and Us-67 Near The Irion- Tom Green County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
